perturbation.original_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW; however, its application to their subsidiaries and related companies is subject to separate written agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the amendment applies to PCQ and ABW and *all* of their subsidiaries and related companies. The modified text contradicts this by stating that while it applies to PCQ and ABW, application to their subsidiaries and related companies requires a *separate written agreement*. This creates uncertainty about whether the amendment automatically extends to the subsidiaries and related companies, thus creating a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
AGREED TO BY:
/s/ Steven Malin
/s/ Howard Meltzer
- --------------------------

perturbation.changed_text:
AGREED TO BY:
/s/ Steven Malin
/s/ Howard Meltzer
- --------------------------
---------------------------------
A.B. Watley, Inc.
PC Quote, Inc.
Mr. Steven Malin
Mr. Howard Meltzer
Director
President
Date: 12/5/96
Date: Undetermined
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement states a specific date (12/12/96) the PC Quote signed the agreement. The modified text replaces that date with "Undetermined," creating uncertainty as to when the agreement was actually ratified by PC Quote. This contradicts the prior statement establishing December 9, 1996, as the effective date, which relied on the agreement of both parties.
